message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.LG 

Reasoning: The paper proposes a new approach for the design and analysis of randomized gossip algorithms, which can be used to solve the average consensus problem. This problem is related to distributed computing, which falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the RBK method, which is used for solving linear systems, and its application as a gossip algorithm. This connects the paper to the sub-category of Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) and Scientific Computing (cs.SC). The paper also discusses the duality of randomized gossip algorithms, which can be related to Information Theory (cs.IT) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper presents experimental results, which can be related to Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
